creator: richard.zschech@cqrdata.com
text:
SVGDOMImplementation.createDocument(null, null, null) should create an empty
document with no root element. Instead it fails with a NullPointerException.

The specification for DOMImplementation.createDocument says it returns:
A new Document object with its document element. If the NamespaceURI,
qualifiedName, and doctype are null, the returned Document is empty with no
document element.

As an example xerces DOMImplementationImpl does this.

creator: deweese@apache.org
text: This should be fixed in CVS in the next few days.
This is now fixed in CVS.
creator: deweese@apache.org
